verses.kjv: O God, thou hast cast us off, thou hast scattered us, thou hast been displeased; O turn thyself to us again.
verses.ct: God, you have rejected us and broken through our defenses. You have been angry with us — please restore us again.

verses.kjv: Thou hast made the earth to tremble; thou hast broken it: heal the breaches thereof; for it shaketh.
verses.ct: You have shaken the land and split it open. Repair its cracks, because it is still trembling.

verses.kjv: Thou hast shewed thy people hard things: thou hast made us to drink the wine of astonishment.
verses.ct: You have put your people through terrible suffering. You have made us drink a wine that left us staggering.

verses.kjv: Thou hast given a banner to them that fear thee, that it may be displayed because of the truth. Selah.
verses.ct: But you have raised a rallying flag for those who are wholeheartedly dedicated to you, so it can be lifted high in the name of truth. Selah.

verses.kjv: That thy beloved may be delivered; save with thy right hand, and hear me.
verses.ct: Rescue the ones you love! Save us with your powerful hand, and answer me.

verses.kjv: God hath spoken in his holiness; I will rejoice, I will divide Shechem, and mete out the valley of Succoth.
verses.ct: God has declared from his sanctuary: 'I will celebrate! I will divide up Shechem and measure out the valley of Succoth.

verses.kjv: Gilead is mine, and Manasseh is mine; Ephraim also is the strength of mine head; Judah is my lawgiver;
verses.ct: Gilead belongs to me, and Manasseh belongs to me. Ephraim is my helmet, and Judah is my ruling staff.

verses.kjv: Moab is my washpot; over Edom will I cast out my shoe: Philistia, triumph thou because of me.
verses.ct: Moab is my washbasin. I will throw my sandal over Edom to claim it. Philistia, shout in defeat because of me.'

verses.kjv: Who will bring me into the strong city? who will lead me into Edom?
verses.ct: Who will bring me into the fortified city? Who will lead me all the way to Edom?

verses.kjv: Wilt not thou, O God, which hadst cast us off? and thou, O God, which didst not go out with our armies?
verses.ct: Isn't it you, God — even though you had rejected us? You, God, who stopped marching out with our armies?

verses.kjv: Give us help from trouble: for vain is the help of man.
verses.ct: Give us help against our enemy, because human assistance is worthless.

verses.kjv: Through God we shall do valiantly: for he it is that shall tread down our enemies.
verses.ct: With God on our side, we will fight with courage, because he is the one who will crush our enemies.
